job_title: Administrative Assistant in Kailua Kona, HI
pros: 21 holidays, 13 sick days.
cons: Low pay, high work load

pros: Great benefits, including vacation/sick leave. Recognizes growth potential in current staff & supports their advancement by providing coaching, training and other PD opportunities.
cons: Challenge finding and retaining qualified staff

review_title: A company with an excellent mission and cares about its employees
pros: Great people to work with; opportunities for advancement; community-focused.
cons: Like most non-profits, wish they could pay more!

pros: PACT is a great local organization that helps the local community of Hawai'i. Coworkers are diverse and friendly. Little to no drama.
cons: Pay is fairly low for work expected especially living in Hawai'i.

pros: The people I directly worked with were great
cons: Everything was so old, dated, and employees were scared to put their desks on one side of the building due to if a potential earthquake were to come, the building would have collapsed.

pros: Flexibility with time and good environment
cons: Can be hectic at the exam time

review_title: Great benefits, lots of demands on workers
pros:
Benefits- time off and sick leave
Part office work/ WFH
Supportive management
cons: Micromanaging supervisors to ensure contract obligations. Often feels like they don’t trust the work you do.

pros: Great flexibility and work culture
cons: Pay and benefits. No room for growth

review_title: One of the best companies I've worked for!
pros: During the pandemic, they made sure to do activities during the month that help our minds/bodies... Yoga on Zoom, brought in speakers on various topics for work and ourselves, book clubs, and guided imagery meditation just to name a few. They went the extra mile to make everyone feel together and included. They truly have the communities best interest in mind and are constantly planning activities and services to help those that need it.
cons: So far I don't have any.

pros:
Great team
Mission driven
Excellent benefits
cons: Lots of work with clients and projects

job_title: Data Entry/Administrative Assistant in Kailua Kona, HI
pros: The environment and colleagues was fantastic. The benefit was absolutely amazing.
cons: nothing to complain, only low pay rate.

pros:
This company really takes care of their Staff. They offer 7 hours of vacation and 4 hours of sick leave a pay period. Great health care package and 401k after one year of employment. 
The staff are knowledgeable and well trained. They come with a listening ear and a helping hand. It really warms my heart to know that I'm making a difference not just in a child's life but that child's entire family.
cons: Need more programs like PACT.

pros: You get to work with nice co-teachers.
cons:
I was a new hire who unfortunately caught a stomach bug during their probationary period. I didn't even know how to properly report it either due to them not giving me an employee handbook until three weeks in (my final week with them).

Once I came back and got everything right with the schedule, etc., I was terminated from their employment. Absolutely devastating. They promise career advancement and training but will kick you to the curb when you get sick. (The nice teachers that I worked with said they were glad they had a third person in the room and I was doing a good job too. Their jobs are now even harder because there are only two of them again).

After I was terminated (on a workday might I add), they had me walk out of the building without letting me say goodbye to the teachers or kids that I worked with, and they wouldn't even let me get my backpack in the classroom on my own. I was just forced to sit outside while someone got it for me. Incredibly humiliating. 

PACT is a non-profit, so why didn't they treat me, another human being, with kindness? Did I complain when I saw run-down areas in the building or roaches of all things? No, I didn't. I just cleaned up the areas (dust, bugs, etc.) and gave them the benefit of the doubt because I loved being employed with them.

This experience with this "non-profit" organization has ruined early childhood education for me. I will no longer be pursuing a career in education after this. You claim there's a teacher shortage, and yet you contribute to it.

pros: Supportive team and supervisors. Staff wellness is a priority. Monthly agency all-staff meetings and trainings. Great mission, vision, organizational values and culture.
cons: Its a non-profit so funding is dependent on grants and contributions.

pros: Celebrating my first year at PACT and looking forward to another great year ahead!!!
cons: None yet! I truly enjoy going to work every day!

review_title: Overall great company to work for
pros: Great management, flexible hours, great benefits (PTO, sick leave, admin)
cons: Lack of supervision/support at times

review_title: Commitment and Care for Community & Staff
pros:
- True care for children, families and community
- Organization with heart & a solid mission
- Great benefits
- Care for staff
cons: - It's hard work (but so meaningful and important)

pros: Great benefits. Supportive co-workers and supervisors. Agency supports Hawaii people, families, and communities making the work fulfilling.
cons: Workload may be large at times, but the outcome is gratifying.

pros:
Excellent benefits 21 days PAID vacations, 12 days sick
All state and federal holidays
Employee well-being at forefront
Supportive environment
cons: Hard work with families but well worth it

review_title: If you want to do something meaningful
pros: Incredible people, secure, good pay, flexible
cons: Work can be demanding but so worth it

pros:
Great benefits
Dedicated / compassionate staff
Company emphasizes wellness of staff and clients
cons:
Pay could be better
Workload can be heavy

pros: Great company to work for! I applied for PACT because not only do I believe the work they do but because they have been recognized as one of the best places to work in the state - and I can say first hand that it's true! Best decision I've made in my career.
cons: None so far that I've experienced.

pros: Flexible and lots of time off.
cons: No work life balance, unrealistic expectations, higher management does not take accountability and will blame the workers for everything that goes wrong. Over working staff, always understaffed, and an abusive work environment.

pros: The salary is good, and the company really takes care of the employees by giving then great benefits and training.
cons: There is constantly more new work to be added to your plate. And they tend to move people around in departments. Which sometimes pushes people away from wanting to work there.

pros: The company really cares about the employee and provide lots of employee support with time off, wellness breaks and activities. The people are passionate about helping children and families.
cons: Lots of work that can be challenging.

pros: Good coworkers and time off
cons: Leadership treats employees horrible and doesn’t listen to their employees

review_title: A caring and supportive organization who gives back to the community and offers exceptional benefits.
pros: Very supportive leadership team who actively supports employee development. All employees are offered 21 days of vacation and a generous 401K match.  Awarded Best Places to Work Hawaii award in 2019.
cons: None - it's a wonderful place to work and feel good about giving back to the community across the Hawaiian islands.

pros: Employees are passionate about helping their clients and community
cons: Like all nonprofits, pay usually does not compete with for profit. Average benefits

pros: Lots of time off, fellow employees are passionate about helping people
cons: Lots of work, sometimes frustrating because the people we are trying to help don't do their part to help themselves

pros: very supportive and healthy work environment
cons: as a non-profit the pay is less than desired

pros: Great place to work in non profit sector
cons: Lower pay however great for entry level

pros: strengthening families and communities by providing opportunities
cons: Non for profit, not much room for growth

pros: Great with self-care, gave mental health days
cons: Budget cuts, program downsize was always a fear
